I2C SVT UVM Documentation main page

Version O-2018.12

Introduction
This is the Class Reference Manual of Synopsys I2C SVT VIP.

The Synopsys VIP for I2C is a suite of advanced verification components and data objects based on SystemVerilog UVM-compliant technology. This on-line help contains information about the classes, functions, and member variables. It shows class hierarchy and contents and it provides links you can use to navigate to more details. Below is the summary of the components and the user interface of the Synopsys I2C SVT VIP.

I2C SVT VIP Components

  • svt_i2c_master_agent Defines an agent for the I2C Master component. The master agent encapsulates master sequencer, master driver, and monitor. The master agent can be configured to operate in active mode and passive mode.
  • svt_i2c_slave_agent Defines an agent for the I2C Slave component. The slave agent encapsulates slave sequencer, slave driver, and monitor. The slave agent can be configured to operate in active mode and passive mode.
  • svt_i2c_system_env Defines a System ENV for the I2C SVT suite. The I2C System ENV encapsulates I2C master agents, I2C slave agents, system sequencer and I2C system configuration. The number of master and slave agents is configured based on the system configuration provided by the user.
I2C SVT VIP User Interface

Interfaces and Modports:
SystemVerilog models signal connections using interfaces and modports. Interfaces define the set of signals which make up a port connection. Modports define the collection of signals for a given port, the direction of the signals, and the clock with respect to which these signals are driven and sampled. I2C SVT VIP provides the below interfaces:

  • svt_i2c_if

Configuration Objects:
Configuration data objects convey the system level and agent level testbench configuration. The configuration data objects contain built-in constraints, which come into effect when the configuration objects are randomized. The I2C SVT VIP defines following configuration classes:

  • svt_i2c_configuration (I2C Base configuration)
  • svt_i2c_agent_configuration (I2C Agent configuration to configure Master/Slave Agent)
  • svt_i2c_system_configuration (I2C System configuration)

Transaction Objects:
Transaction objects, which are extended from the uvm_sequence_item base class, define a unit of I2C protocol information that is passed across the bus. The attributes of transaction objects are public and are accessed directly for setting and getting values. Most transaction attributes can be randomized. The transaction object can represent the desired activity to be simulated on the bus, or the actual bus activity that was monitored. I2C SVT VIP defines following transaction classes:

  • svt_i2c_transaction (I2C Base transaction)
  • svt_i2c_master_transaction (I2C Master Transaction)
  • svt_i2c_slave_transaction (I2C Slave Transaction)

Analysis port:
The monitor in the agent provides an analysis port. At the end of the transaction, the monitor within the agent provides the completed svt_i2c_transaction object from its analysis port.
The analysis ports for transmit and recieve ports are:

  • svt_i2c_master_monitor :: xact_observed_port
  • svt_i2c_slave_monitor :: xact_observed_port

Callbacks:
Callbacks are an access mechanism that enable the insertion of user-defined code and allow access to objects for scoreboarding and functional coverage. Each master and slave component is associated with a callback class that contains a set of callback methods. I2C VIP provides following callbacks classes:

  • svt_i2c_master_callback (Master callback class)
  • svt_i2c_slave_callback (Slave callback class)
  • svt_i2c_master_monitor_callback (Master monitor callback class)
  • svt_i2c_slave_monitor_callback (Slave monitor callback class)

Functional Coverage:
The Synopsys I2C Verification IP provides default transaction coverage for master and slave component. The coverage is shaped based on the configuration. I2C VIP provides below coverage callback classes:

  • svt_i2c_master_monitor_def_cov_data_callbacks
The master coverage data callback class defines default data and event information that are used to implement the coverage groups. The master coverage data callback class is extended from callback class svt_i2c_master_monitor_callback . This class itself does not contain any cover groups.
  • svt_i2c_master_monitor_def_cov_callback
This class is extended from the master coverage data callback class. This class includes default cover groups.

  • svt_i2c_slave_monitor_def_cov_data_callbacks
The slave coverage data callback class defines default data and event information that are used to implement the coverage groups. The slave coverage data callback class is extended from callback class svt_i2c_slave_monitor_callback . This class itself does not contain any cover groups.
  • svt_i2c_slave_monitor_def_cov_callback
This class is extended from the slave coverage data callback class. This class includes default cover groups.

Protocol Checks:
For a complete list of protocol checks supported by the I2C SVT VIP, please click on the "Protocol Checks" tab in this class reference documentation.

Sequence Collection:
The I2C SVT VIP provides a collection of I2C Master and Slave sequences. These sequences can be registered with agent sequencers within Master and Slave agents respectively to generate different types of I2C scenarios. For a complete list of Sequences supported by the I2C SVT VIP, please click on the "Sequences" tab in this class reference documentation.
